newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's RAMS bond issue priced.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's RAMS bond issue priced.

text.p: Australian non-bank home lender RAMS said its A$200 million mortgaged backed issue, the fourth in its Series 2 bonds, was priced at 16.85 basis points over the 30-day BBSW.
Settlement date for the bonds is March 17.

RAMS said it had maintained a low price margin for this bond in a climate of strong competition in the mortgage-backed funds investment market. "Considering the growing number of bond issues available in the market at the moment, this latest issue has been a success for RAMS," said RAMS director Robin Redfern.
"The price once again confirms that investors are satisfied with the Series 2 Bond structure," he added.
The issue will be fully fungible with the current Series 2 bonds and increases the total outstandings in the series to A$800 million.
The A Class (Senior) tranches have been rated AAA/Aaa by Standard and Poor's and Moody's with the B Class (Junior) rated AA minus by S&P.
